newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes unchanged against US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes unchanged against US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed flat at 8.3000 against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday from Monday's close on the Shanghai-based interbank foreign exchange market.
The yuan opened up slightly at 8.2995 and hit an intra-day high of 8.2990 early in the session but then fell to consolidate below 8.3000 for most of the session, hitting a low of 8.3008.
Trading was active with most done around 8.3000, traders said.
Dealers said consistent selling prevented the yuan from bouncing back above the 8.3000 level as it did in the past two days.
"The yuan seems to have some difficulty standing above 8.30 because buying has decreased in the wake of intervention from the central bank over the past two days," said one dealer.
But a second dealer said that strong pro-yuan sentiment will push the yuan back above 8.3000.
Dealers expect the yuan to consolidate around the key 8.3000 level on Wednesday.
The yuan closed down at 7.3605 from 7.3501 against 100 Japanese yen and ended up at an intra-day high of 1.0728 from 1.0738 against the Hong Kong dollar.
